questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is currently doing user acceptance testing for a global customer service project that leverages Service Cloud. A stakeholder is executing a test case for a specific user story. The stakeholder has provided this feedback:
The functionality described in the test case is working as expected.
The stakeholder wants to change the label of several fields described in the test case.
The stakeholder wants to add two new fields that were excluded from the test case
Which step should the business analyst take next?

choices.C: Acknowledge the feedback, create a new user story that includes the field changes, and ask the stakeholder to update the existing test case to show it was successfully tested.
choices.A: Acknowledge the feedback, create a new test case that includes the field changes, and assign the test case back to the stakeholder for immediate testing.
choices.B: Acknowledge the feedback, update the existing user story to include the field changes, and assign the user story back to the technical team for immediate development.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Acknowledge the feedback, create a new user story that includes the field changes, and ask the stakeholder to update the existing test case to show it was successfully tested.

Selected Answer: C
If the user story as it is gets accepted but needs changes, then you should make a new user story for those changes if the story functionality was rejected/failed then you'd be able to assign it back for development.

Also you should never add new test cases during the testing phase, just bad practice - it also doesn't state that the changes were developed and then moved back to testing, so looks like the BA just added the field changes as a test case with no dev work IMO

This is why its C not B or A
A should be correct, this question is testing the small in INVEST. A user story should be small, updating it and adding field should mean writing a new user story.

A business analyst (BA) at Northern Trail Outfitters has been asked to prepare documentation Including acceptance criteria and definition of done for a Heroku project.
Which way should the BA approach creation of this documentation?

choices.A: Include the overall perspective for acceptance criteria and the persona's perspective for definition of done.
choices.C: Create one consolidated set of documentation as the two terms are synonymous and used interchangeably.
choices.B: Include the persona's perspective for acceptance criteria and the overall perspective for definition of done.

discussion.content:
A.
When creating documentation, including acceptance criteria and the definition of done for a Heroku project, the business analyst (BA) should approach it by including the overall perspective for acceptance criteria and the persona's perspective for the definition of done.

questions.question_text:
A business analyst (BA) is working with the support team at Cloud Kicks (CK) on a Service Cloud implementation. The BA has decided to create a process map to understand CK's current merchandise return process.
What are the top three benefits of creating a process map?

choices.B: Identifies improvements, decreases project costs, and starts the change process
choices.C: Engages stakeholders, identifies improvements, and starts the change process
choices.A: Builds accountability, increases revenue, and decreases overall time spent on requirements

questions.question_text:
As part of the digital transformation at Cloud Kicks, company leaders have decided to adopt Service Cloud as its CRM platform for customer service and support. Executive directors are supportive of the initiative, but end users are unconvinced and prefer to remain on the current platform.
What should the business analyst do to gam the end users' cooperation?

choices.A: Identity key stakeholders and develop relationships with them as a trusted advisor; involve stakeholders and end users in the design of the new solution; and act as a liaison between business and technical teams.
choices.B: Use an assertive influencing style; demonstrate authority and expertise; outline the project objectives; and make sure end users know that the decision has been made and the time to make changes has passed.
choices.C: Respond to end users with empathy and accommodate their needs; translate the end users' needs into technical requirements; and deliver the project to the developers to implement the solution.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Identify key stakeholders and develop relationships with them as a trusted advisor; involve stakeholders and end users in the design of the new solution; and act as a liaison between business and technical teams.
